TypeSignature.Value: public abstract class AbstractCursor : Java.Lang.Object, Android.Database.ICrossProcessCursor, IDisposable

.class public auto ansi abstract beforefieldinit AbstractCursor extends Java.Lang.Object implements class Android.Database.ICrossProcessCursor, class Android.Database.ICursor, class Android.Runtime.IJavaObject, class Java.IO.ICloseable, class System.IDisposable

Docs.summary: This is an abstract cursor class that handles a lot of the common code that all cursors need to deal with and is provided for convenience reasons.

remarks.para: This is an abstract cursor class that handles a lot of the common code that all cursors need to deal with and is provided for convenience reasons.

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyhidebysig newslot virtual instance void CheckPosition() cil managed

Docs.summary: This function throws CursorIndexOutOfBoundsException if the cursor position is out of bounds.

remarks.para: This function throws CursorIndexOutOfBoundsException if the cursor position is out of bounds. Subclass implementations of the get functions should call this before attempting to retrieve data.

Docs.summary: Closes the Cursor, releasing all of its resources and making it completely invalid.

remarks.para: Closes the Cursor, releasing all of its resources and making it completely invalid. Unlike a call to will not make the Cursor valid again.

remarks.para: Return total number of columns

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void Deactivate() cil managed

Docs.summary: Deactivates the Cursor, making all calls on it fail until is called.

remarks.para: Deactivates the Cursor, making all calls on it fail until is called. Inactive Cursors use fewer resources than active Cursors. Calling will make the cursor active again.

Docs.summary: Returns a bundle of extra values.

remarks.para:
Get method documentation [Android Documentation]
Returns a bundle of extra values. This is an optional way for cursors to provide out-of-band metadata to their users. One use of this is for reporting on the progress of network requests that are required to fetch data for the cursor.
These values may only change when requery is called.

Set method documentation [Android Documentation]
Sets a that will be returned by .

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual void FillWindow (int position, Android.Database.CursorWindow window);
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void FillWindow(int32 position, class Android.Database.CursorWindow window) cil managed

Docs.param: The zero-based index of the first row to copy into the window.
The window to fill.
Docs.summary: Copies cursor data into the window.

remarks.para: Copies cursor data into the window.
Clears the window and fills it with data beginning at the requested row position until all of the data in the cursor is exhausted or the window runs out of space.

The filled window uses the same row indices as the original cursor. For example, if you fill a window starting from row 5 from the cursor, you can query the contents of row 5 from the window just by asking it for row 5 because there is a direct correspondence between the row indices used by the cursor and the window.
The current position of the cursor, as returned by , is not changed by this method.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance unsigned int8[] GetBlob(int32 column) cil managed

Docs.param: the zero-based index of the target column.
Docs.summary: Returns the value of the requested column as a byte array.

remarks.para: Returns the value of the requested column as a byte array.
The result and whether this method throws an exception when the column value is null or the column type is not a blob type is implementation-defined.

remarks.para: Returns the zero-based index for the given column name, or -1 if the column doesn't exist. If you expect the column to exist use instead, which will make the error more clear.

remarks.para: Returns the zero-based index for the given column name, or throws if the column doesn't exist. If you're not sure if a column will exist or not use and check for -1, which is more efficient than catching the exceptions.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance bool Move(int32 offset) cil managed

Docs.param: the offset to be applied from the current position.
Docs.summary: Move the cursor by a relative amount, forward or backward, from the current position.

remarks.para: Move the cursor by a relative amount, forward or backward, from the current position. Positive offsets move forwards, negative offsets move backwards. If the final position is outside of the bounds of the result set then the resultant position will be pinned to -1 or count() depending on whether the value is off the front or end of the set, respectively.

This method will return true if the requested destination was reachable, otherwise, it returns false. For example, if the cursor is at currently on the second entry in the result set and move(-5) is called, the position will be pinned at -1, and false will be returned.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance bool MoveToFirst() cil managed

Docs.summary: Move the cursor to the first row.

remarks.para: Move the cursor to the first row.
This method will return false if the cursor is empty.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance bool MoveToLast() cil managed

Docs.summary: Move the cursor to the last row.

remarks.para: Move the cursor to the last row.
This method will return false if the cursor is empty.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance bool MoveToNext() cil managed

Docs.summary: Move the cursor to the next row.

remarks.para: Move the cursor to the next row.
This method will return false if the cursor is already past the last entry in the result set.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance bool MoveToPosition(int32 position) cil managed

Docs.param: the zero-based position to move to.
Docs.summary: Move the cursor to an absolute position.

remarks.para: Move the cursor to an absolute position. The valid range of values is -1 <= position <= count.
This method will return true if the request destination was reachable, otherwise, it returns false.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance bool MoveToPrevious() cil managed

Docs.summary: Move the cursor to the previous row.

remarks.para: Move the cursor to the previous row.
This method will return false if the cursor is already before the first entry in the result set.

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual bool OnMove (int oldPosition, int newPosition);
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance bool OnMove(int32 oldPosition, int32 newPosition) cil managed

Docs.param: the position that we're moving from
the position that we're moving to
Docs.summary: This function is called every time the cursor is successfully scrolled to a new position, giving the subclass a chance to update any state it may have.

remarks.para: This function is called every time the cursor is successfully scrolled to a new position, giving the subclass a chance to update any state it may have. If it returns false the move function will also do so and the cursor will scroll to the beforeFirst position.

Docs.summary: Returns the current position of the cursor in the row set.

remarks.para: Returns the current position of the cursor in the row set. The value is zero-based. When the row set is first returned the cursor will be at positon -1, which is before the first row. After the last row is returned another call to next() will leave the cursor past the last entry, at a position of count().

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void RegisterContentObserver(class Android.Database.ContentObserver observer) cil managed

Docs.param: the object that gets notified when the content backing the cursor changes.
Docs.summary: Register an observer that is called when changes happen to the content backing this cursor.

remarks.para: Register an observer that is called when changes happen to the content backing this cursor. Typically the data set won't change until is called.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void RegisterDataSetObserver(class Android.Database.DataSetObserver observer) cil managed

Docs.param: the object that gets notified when the cursors data set changes.
Docs.summary: Register an observer that is called when changes happen to the contents of the this cursors data set, for example, when the data set is changed via , , or .

remarks.para: Register an observer that is called when changes happen to the contents of the this cursors data set, for example, when the data set is changed via , , or .

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance bool Requery() cil managed

Docs.summary: Performs the query that created the cursor again, refreshing its contents.

remarks.para:
Performs the query that created the cursor again, refreshing its contents. This may be done at any time, including after a call to .
Since this method could execute a query on the database and potentially take a while, it could cause ANR if it is called on Main (UI) thread. A warning is printed if this method is being executed on Main thread.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance class Android.OS.Bundle Respond(class Android.OS.Bundle extras) cil managed

Docs.param: extra values, or . Never null.
Docs.summary: This is an out-of-band way for the the user of a cursor to communicate with the cursor.

remarks.para: This is an out-of-band way for the the user of a cursor to communicate with the cursor. The structure of each bundle is entirely defined by the cursor.
One use of this is to tell a cursor that it should retry its network request after it reported an error.

Docs.param: The content resolver from the caller's context.
The URI to watch for changes. This can be a specific row URI, or a base URI for a whole class of content.
Docs.summary: Specifies a content URI to watch for changes.

remarks.para: Specifies a content URI to watch for changes.

Docs.summary: This API supports the Mono for Android infrastructure and is not intended to be used directly from your code.
Docs.value: A which contains the java.lang.Class JNI value corresponding to this type.

remarks.para: This property is used to control which jclass is provided to methods like .

Docs.summary: This API supports the Mono for Android infrastructure and is not intended to be used directly from your code.
Docs.value: A which provides the declaring type.

remarks.para: This property is used to control virtual vs. non virtual method dispatch against the underlying JNI object. When this property is equal to the declaring type, then virtual method invocation against the JNI object is performed; otherwise, we assume that the method was overridden by a derived type, and perform non-virtual methdo invocation.
